p: Table 1 consists of the Pearson correlation coefficients ( r) between Google Trends data and the respective categories of total (cumulative) and daily cases and deaths (where applicable), worldwide (January 22 to March 17) and in the five most affected European countries (February 15 to March 17) (ie, Italy, Spain, France, Germany, and the United Kingdom). Note that for the total worldwide cases excluding China, the Pearson correlation coefficient ( r) is .9430, with P<.001.
